definitions: publication issued at regular intervals containing articles and information
examples: She subscribes to several scientific periodicals for research
The library has an extensive collection of historical periodicals

definitions: quality of occurring at regular intervals in time or space
examples: The periodicity of the comet's appearance is well documented
Scientists study the periodicity of economic cycles and trends

definitions: person who travels from place to place, especially for work
examples: The peripatetic teacher visits three different schools each week
As a peripatetic consultant, she rarely stays in one city

definitions: external device connected to computer for input or output
examples: The printer is a common peripheral for most office computers
Gaming peripherals include specialized keyboards and high-precision mice

definitions: outer limits or edge of an area or object
examples: Trees grow along the periphery of the parking lot
She lives on the periphery of the city limits

definitions: optical instrument for viewing objects above eye level using mirrors
examples: The submarine captain raised the periscope to scan the horizon
Children made toy periscopes from cardboard tubes and mirrors

definitions: food or goods that decay quickly and require special storage
examples: Store perishables in the refrigerator to prevent spoilage
The grocery delivery includes both perishables and non-perishable items

definitions: small plant with blue or purple flowers that spreads as groundcover
small edible marine snail with spiral shell
examples: Periwinkle covers the shaded areas beneath the oak trees
The garden path is bordered with blooming periwinkle plants
We collected periwinkles from the rocky shore at low tide
The restaurant serves periwinkles as a traditional seaside appetizer

definitions: criminal offense of lying under oath in legal proceedings
examples: The witness was charged with perjury after contradicting earlier testimony
Committing perjury in court can result in serious criminal penalties

definitions: additional benefit provided to employees beyond regular salary
examples: Free gym membership is a popular perk at many companies
The job offers excellent perks including flexible hours and healthcare

definitions: chemical treatment that creates permanent waves or curls in hair
examples: She gets a perm every six months to maintain her curls
The salon offers various types of perms for different hair textures

definitions: permanently frozen layer of soil found in arctic and subarctic regions
examples: Climate change is causing permafrost to melt in northern regions
Buildings in Alaska must be specially designed for permafrost conditions

definitions: state or quality of lasting indefinitely without significant change
examples: The monument was built to symbolize the permanence of their friendship
Digital archives question traditional notions of permanence in record keeping

definitions: quality of material that allows liquids or gases to pass through
examples: The soil's permeability affects how quickly rainwater drains away
Engineers test the permeability of concrete for waterproofing applications

definitions: way of arranging or ordering a set of things where order matters
examples: There are six permutations of the letters A, B, and C
The puzzle requires finding all possible permutations of the numbers

definitions: chemical compound containing oxygen used for bleaching or disinfecting
examples: Hydrogen peroxide is commonly used to clean minor cuts and wounds
The hairdresser applied peroxide to lighten her client's hair color

definitions: line or plane at right angles to another line or surface
examples: Draw a perpendicular from point A to the base line
The walls meet at perpendicular angles to form square corners

definitions: person who carries out harmful, illegal, or immoral act
examples: Police are still searching for the perpetrator of the robbery
The perpetrator was identified through security camera footage

definitions: act of causing something to continue indefinitely without interruption
examples: The perpetuation of cultural traditions requires active community participation
Social media contributes to the perpetuation of certain stereotypes

definitions: state of lasting forever or for an indefinitely long time
examples: The land was donated to the park in perpetuity
The trust fund was established to provide income in perpetuity

definitions: persistent harassment or cruel treatment based on race, religion, or beliefs
examples: Many refugees flee their countries to escape religious persecution
The documentary examines the persecution of minorities throughout history

definitions: continued effort and determination despite difficulties, obstacles, or discouragement
examples: Her perseverance through medical school inspired many other students
Success in learning a new language requires patience and perseverance

definitions: sweet orange fruit that grows on trees in warm climates
examples: The persimmon tree produces fruit that ripens in late autumn
She made persimmon bread using fruit from her backyard tree

definitions: quality of continuing steadily despite problems or difficulties
examples: His persistence in applying finally landed him the dream job
The persistence of the rain ruined our outdoor wedding plans

definitions: social role or character adopted by person in public settings
examples: The actor's public persona differs greatly from his private personality
She developed a professional persona for her business networking events

definitions: person of distinction, importance, or high social rank
examples: Several notable personages attended the embassy's diplomatic reception
The biography chronicles the life of this historical personage

definitions: quality or condition of being an individual person with rights
examples: The debate centered on when personhood begins in human development
Legal personhood grants certain rights and protections under the law

definitions: representation of thing or abstraction as person with human qualities
examples: Death is often shown as personification wearing a dark cloak
The poet uses personification to give the wind human emotions

definitions: moisture excreted through skin pores to cool the body
examples: Perspiration dripped from his forehead during the intense workout
The athlete wiped away perspiration between sets at the gym

definitions: act of convincing someone to do or believe through reasoning
examples: Her powers of persuasion convinced the board to approve funding
The salesman used gentle persuasion rather than aggressive tactics

definitions: disturbance or deviation from regular motion, behavior, or state
examples: The asteroid's perturbation altered its expected orbital path
Market perturbations can create opportunities for experienced investors

definitions: action of corrupting or distorting something from its original purpose
examples: Critics called the ruling a perversion of justice and fairness
The dictator's perversion of democratic ideals destroyed public trust

definitions: person whose sexual behavior is regarded as abnormal or unacceptable
examples: The neighborhood watch warned residents about a suspected pervert
Police arrested the pervert for inappropriate behavior near the school

definitions: basic monetary unit used in several Latin American countries
examples: The Mexican peso fluctuated against the dollar this week
She exchanged her dollars for pesos at the airport

definitions: tendency to see worst aspect of things or believe worst will happen
examples: His pessimism about the economy affects his investment decisions
The team's pessimism disappeared after winning three games straight

definitions: destructive insect or animal that attacks crops, food, or livestock
examples: Farmers use various methods to control pests in their fields
The apartment building hired exterminators to eliminate the pest problem

definitions: substance used for destroying insects or organisms harmful to plants
examples: Organic farmers avoid using synthetic pesticides on their crops
The pesticide effectively controlled the aphid infestation

definitions: fatal epidemic disease that spreads quickly through a population
examples: Medieval Europe suffered from recurring waves of pestilence
The pestilence decimated entire villages before modern medicine developed

definitions: heavy tool with rounded end used for crushing substances in mortar
examples: She ground the spices with a marble pestle and mortar
The pharmacist used a pestle to prepare the prescription compound

definitions: colored leaflike part of flower that surrounds reproductive organs
examples: Rose petals scattered across the wedding aisle looked beautiful
Each daisy has white petals surrounding a yellow center

definitions: woman of small stature and slender build
examples: The petite actress often wears heels for red carpet events
This boutique specializes in clothing designed specifically for petite women

definitions: person who makes formal written request to authority or court
examples: The petitioner presented her case before the appeals court
Hundreds of petitioners signed the document requesting policy changes

definitions: seabird that flies low over ocean waves feeding on small fish
examples: Storm petrels dance across the water surface while feeding
The research vessel spotted several species of petrel during the voyage

definitions: chemical product obtained from petroleum through refining or processing
examples: Many plastics are made from petrochemicals derived from crude oil
The petrochemical plant produces materials for various industrial uses

definitions: image created by carving or pecking on rock surface by ancient peoples
examples: The canyon walls display petroglyphs created thousands of years ago
Archaeologists documented the petroglyphs before the dam flooded the area

definitions: refined petroleum used as fuel in internal combustion engines
examples: The car needs petrol before we start our road trip
Petrol prices increased significantly during the summer driving season

definitions: thick flammable liquid found underground used to produce fuel and chemicals
examples: The company drills for petroleum in offshore oil fields
Petroleum refineries transform crude oil into various useful products
